barrel.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a large curved container with a flat top and bottom, made of wood or metal, and used for storing beer, wine etc
barrel.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The wine is aged in oak barrels.
barrel.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a unit of measurement for oil, equal to 159 litres
barrel.translation[0].definitions[2].def: the part of a gun that the bullets are fired through
barrel.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to move very fast, especially in an uncontrolled way
barrel.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: A vehicle barreled out of a shopping center and crashed into the side of my car.
barrel.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a large round container with a flat top and bottom, used for storing and carrying liquids such as oil and beer
barrel.translation[2].definitions[1].def: an amount of a liquid contained in a barrel, used as unit of measurement, especially in the oil industry
barrel.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: There were fears that the price of crude would drop as far as $15 a barrel.
The country produces more than 650,000 barrels per day of crude oil.
